intro: Phyllocladus trichomanoides var. trichomanoides, commonly known as the silver pine, is a small evergreen tree native to New Zealand. It has distinctive silvery-blue foliage that provides a striking visual contrast against its dark bark. The plant produces small, cone-like structures that contain both male and female reproductive organs. Its leaves are alternate and scale-like, contributing to its unique appearance. The species is adapted to coastal and subalpine environments, showcasing its resilience to harsh conditions.
